description:
The devilish haremking Issei Hyoudou is back for more outrageous Oppai Battle Entertainment in the scintillating second season of High School DxD! Fans who like their hardcore action spiked with a double dose of fan service won't be able to pry their eyes off all the scorching supernatural schoolgirls waiting for them in Season Two. So what are you waiting for? Plant yourself in front of the boob tube and watch a harem of devil hotties show you how much fun it is to be bad!

(Source: FUNimation)

Episode 1 was previewed at a screening in United Cinema Toyosu, Tokyo on June 29, 2013. Regular broadcasting began on July 7, 2013.
The Blu-ray and DVD Director's Cut includes an extra 3 minutes per episode.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

She married on December 5, 2012, her 32nd birthday, but later announced her divorce on April 30, 2020.

She was part of the seiyuu unit with [Hitomi Nabatame](https://anilist.co/staff/95184/) called "Hitomi Nabatame to Shizuka Itou" (生天目仁美と伊藤静) under Geneon's cosmic★motion label. Together they are known by the name Hitoshizuku (ひとしずく).

[Profile (Link Plan)](http://link-plan.net/talent_taketatsu.html) | [Website](http://ayanataketatsu.jp) | [Website (Pony Canyon)](https://ayanataketatsu.jp/) | [Website (Fanclub)](https://ayanakoukoku.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/ayana_taketatsu/) | [(Old) Blog](https://ameblo.jp/strawberry-ayana/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayana_take) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayachi_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/taketatsuofficial) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27399.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayana_Taketatsu) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/竹達彩奈)

Attended Nihon Narration Engi Kenkyuujo before becoming affiliated with her first management company. She works for Link Plan and was formerly affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Assemble Heart. Because of her strong voice, she often voiced tsundere characters.

She is a member of the duo [Petit Milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523/petit-milady) with fellow voice actress [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686/Aoi-Yuuki).

She married voice actor [Yuuki Kaji](https://anilist.co/staff/95672/) on her 30th birthday in 2019. On June 30, 2022 she announced that she was expecting her first child with Kaji.

__Height:__ 157 cm 

[Agency Profile](https://inari-inc.com/talent/yoko-hikasa/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hikasayoko-official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hikasayoko_official/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@hikasayoko_official) | [(Old) Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikasayokoSP)

Co-hosted the popular weekly radio show Odoroki Sentai Momonoki Five (おどろき戦隊モモノキファイブ) with fellow seiyuu [Eriko Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/103983) from 2009 to 2017.
She got married to a person from outside the industry in 2015.
On September 5, 2024, she announced that she was starting her own voice talent agency, [i.nari](https://inari-inc.com/), which would also be representing her going forward.

__[Blog](http://ishibumi.exblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ishibumi_ddd)__

Ishibumi won the Fantasia Grand Price in 2005 with his first book Denpachi, which was later published in 2006, the same year as his second work SLASH/DOG was published. in 2008 he wrote the work that he is most known for, High School DxD. He currently works on several projects at once, and mostly writes for Fantasia Bunko. Ishibumi likes to build Gunpla and play Pokemon in his free time, which he often mentions in his blog. In 2018, Ichiei collapsed from overwork and has fought with several health conditions ever since, which is why he started writing slower in recent years.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gotoujio)__

Junji Gotou is a Japanese animator and character designer, who mainly does animation direction and key animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/436797162)

Married to animator [Maki Fujii](https://anilist.co/staff/101081/).

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

Ryousuke Nakanishi is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and musician, while also known as the representative director of Altus Inc. and managing director Up Dream Inc. He is also a member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers.

**Current Residence:** Osaka, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyama0)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

__Agency:__ Office Osawa
 
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/tanedarisa/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tane_da_dayo/)

On September 1, 2016, Office Osawa announced that Taneda would put her career on hiatus to focus on treatment for her throat, various roles she done were recast during this time such as Erina Nakiri from Food Wars who was replaced by Hisako Kanemoto from Season 3 and onwards.

On August 4, 2017, Office Osawa announced that her treatment was successful and she would gradually return to voice acting.

__Non-anime roles:__
~!
• D.Va in "Overwatch" (VG)
• Kuon in Utawarerumono (VG series)
• Shirasu Azusa in Blue Archive (VG)
!~

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

[Page (I've Sound)](https://www.ive.mu/creater_mix.html)

C.G Mix is one of the main composers of the Japanese music production I've Sound.

The meaning of his name is "Communication Groove mix". C.G mix has already composed many songs for visual novel games and recently, anime theme songs for the I've Sound singers. Also a singer, he also performs songs for visual games but mostly for BL (Boy's Love) games. In 2001, he joined I've Sound and immediately became a composer and arranger of the group. He also features the use of rock music when creating his music but most of his songs are rather categorized as electronica.
